intro: Cicerbita intybacea, commonly known as the common cicerbita, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows and along stream banks. Its leaves are alternate, rough, and often lobed, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in clusters. Cicerbita intybacea is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
